Text.Value: The man doesn't know the meaning of the word respect. He'll double cross us at the first opportunity.
Then run while you still can.
Don't lecture me about goodness. You don't know the first thing about it.

EditorData.logicalname: Karlach was sent to prison before.

Text.Value: Very, very hot.
You ought to reconsider. Divided, the elder brain will create an illithid army, yourself included in its ranks. Together, we can tame it.
Do we now?
Dearest Karlach. I'd busy myself finding Orin if I were you. I'll still be here for any unfinished business, once you've secured your camp.

EditorData.logicalname: Orin alive, Gortash still at the ceremony room

Text.Value: The greater good, Karlach. Something I wouldn't expect you to understand.
Whether or not you accepted my generous offer, the fact stands that you cannot control the elder brain without my expertise.
Oh, you do quite misunderstand. I've already made a deal with your companion. We need each other.
I was so young. I didn't recognise evil when I saw it.
That's it? That's all you have to say to me?
Listen to reason, for once in your life. I'm sorry you feel wronged about how things ended between us, but that was ten years ago. We must look to the future.
Let's not be too hasty. We ought to respect our alliance with Gortash.
You sent me to the Hells. You let Zariel take my heart. As though any of it was yours to give away.
You've heard enough. Attack.
You make it sound like we were lovers. Or friends. But that wasn't it.
There will come a time, sooner than you think, when death comes knocking on your door. You'll swing that door open, and you'll cower before what you see, and you'll beg, 'Please, Karlach. Spare me.'
I never meant to harm you, dear, merely to help you realise your vast potential.
I'm sorry you feel wronged by how things ended between us all those years ago. But now, we must look to the future.
Thanks to you, I don't hope for things anymore. I just take whatever it is I want. See you soon, motherfucker.
To think I ever worked for you. Proudly, too.
Say nothing.
Until it isn't.
Those things were evil - just like their papa.
I can't wait.
You have no future.
You utter brat. You're going to burn this place down!
This was your doing, wasn't it, Karlach? The destruction of my Steel Watch. Such a petty vengeance.
Say goodbye, Gortash.
No; I never agreed to ally with him.
Get out of here while you can, Gortash.
Karlach, stop this. You're burning too hot.
Easy, Karlach; we won't make it far against the Steel Watch.
But I do. I give a shit. I don't hurt the people I love. And I keep my promises, too.
You most certainly will.
You betrayed me for reasons I still don't quite understand. But I suppose evil has no real cause. It just is.
Very clever, fabricating people to do your fighting for you. But they won't be able to protect you forever, Gortash.
It's hard to keep a good woman down, isn't it, Karlach?

EditorData.NodeContext: Voice dripping with sarcasm. He doesn't actually respect her, but he feigns it.

Text.Value: No. You have to stop her. Do it! Now!
Orin's dead, and the Steel Watch is destroyed. I don't think we need much else from you, Gortash.
Ah - a familiar face, and a fondly-remembered one indeed. How have you been, Karlach?
You're wrong, Karlach. I'm sorry you're still sore about how things ended between us, but that was ten years ago. We must look to the future.
Good.
You're agitated. I'd keep an eye on that. My Steel Watch are sensitive to anything they perceive as a threat.
You can't escape me. Wherever you go, I'll find you. Wherever you run, there I'll be.
Were you hoping for something else? A word of wisdom? A hug?
I trusted you. I respected you. It was my job to protect you, and that's what I did.
You feel no regret, do you. All right. How about fear then?

EditorData.logicalname: Karlach was never sent to prison

Text.Value: I don't know. You managed it for a solid decade.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Karlach was never sent to prison)

Text.Value: You can't hurt me. You need me. Whether you and your friend realise it or not.
How wrong you are. You have no clue how to control the elder brain. It will destroy the Sword Coast, yourself included. Together, we can tame it.
Never mind that, Gortash; we've heard all we need from the likes of you.
When you turned on me, I was too dumbstruck to realise what was happening. No way he'd hurt me, I thought.

Synopsis:
Karlach confronts Gortash after ceremony in WYR.

In this dialogue, Karlach is facing the man who sold her to the devil. She hasn't talked to him in 10 years and she's furious for his betrayal. The player can allow Karlach to fight him here, but in most cases they won't.
